image.altText: Composite images of accommodation at Macquarie Island.

props.synopsis: Expeditioners at Australia's research station on Macquarie Island sometimes have to stay in mouldy, asbestos-riddled accommodation blocks. To improve conditions and enhance scientific capabilities, a major upgrade costing hundreds of millions of dollars is underway.

title.children: Clad in asbestos, mouldy and cramped: $371m upgrade for remote science outpost

image.altText: A man with his head bandaged and in a wheelchair being whisked away and surrounded by people

props.synopsis: An Australian man injured on the Singapore Airlines aircraft that suffered extreme turbulence this week says he hopes to bring his wife home in a medical flight.

title.children: Australian couple 'in limbo' for medical evacuation after being injured in Singapore Airlines flight

image.altText: Peter Dutton at a press conference at EastCoast Beverages at Kulnura on NSW Central Coast.

props.synopsis: It's one thing to have an opinion when faced with a hypothetical. It's a completely different matter when that hypothetical becomes a reality, as is about to become the case in the communities Peter Dutton wants nuclear power plants built in.

title.children: Leaders on both sides are putting their foot in it this week — it does not bode well for the next election

image.altText: A sad child sits in a chair with their face hidden behind their hair

props.synopsis: Almost half of the public servants identified in Tasmania's child sexual abuse commission of inquiry are still employed and under internal investigation, six months after the release of the inquiry's report.

title.children: Dozens of Tasmanian public servants under internal investigation due to adverse findings of child sexual abuse inquiry

image.altText: Blue powerballs.

props.synopsis: A lucky ticket-holder has won the entire $150 million Powerball jackpot, becoming Australia's biggest individual lottery winner.

title.children: Australia's biggest lottery winner urged to claim $150 million prize

image.altText: Stack of several thousand dollars of Australian $50 notes

props.synopsis: Winning the lottery could be life-changing if you spend the money right. We spoke to four personal finance experts for their hypothetical tips if you were to receive a windfall.

title.children: What should you do if you've won the lotto or inherited millions? We asked four finance experts

image.altText: Boy wearing glasses with phone light reflecting on his lenses

props.synopsis: With a perfect biological and psychological storm stealing the slumber of teenagers, experts are calling for sleep to become a mainstay of their mental health treatment.

title.children: 'Like a vicious cycle': Australian teens are struggling to get decent sleep, yet experts say they're the ones who need it most

image.altText: A couple stand on a boardwalk taking a pic with a selfie stick with Hobart landscape behind

props.synopsis: Hobart's kunanyi/Mt Wellington attracts more than 400,000 visitors per year, most who drive up a winding road to reach its summit. A review of transport options and the park's management will soon kick off — and will likely include talk of a cable-car.

title.children: Cable-car debate set for reignition amid review of managment of Hobart's mountain and park

image.altText: A man uses a newspaper as others use umbrellas to protect themselves from the heat.

props.synopsis: As India’s election campaign approaches the finish line, voters allege they have been beaten up by police at polling stations, while candidates say they have been encouraged to withdraw from the race.

title.children: As India's election ramps up, some voters allege they were beaten by police at polling stations. Here's why

image.altText: A crowd pulses through the city

props.synopsis: The recent debate highlights a deeper issue in how we treat those who come to Australia seeking better opportunities. It's time to reconsider how we view migrants and listen to their voices during times of public and political outcry.

title.children: Migrants are integral members of Australian society, not just economic units to be managed

image.altText: A composite image of a man and woman, both in their 70s

props.synopsis: An investigator shares the findings of human remains and personal effects recovered from a remote campsite in Victoria's High Country.

title.children: Human remains found at remote site, 60km from burnt out campsite where campers went missing, court hears

image.altText: Surgery theatre, green walls

props.synopsis: In some cases, policyholders have been hit with an increase as high as 17 per cent — experts say Australia's aging population may be to blame.

title.children: 'A snake eating its own tail': Some private health insurance policies have increased up to five times the approved average

image.altText: A close up image of the French president with both hands holding a microphone and flags behind him.

props.synopsis: Emmanuel Macron met with political leaders on Thursday, admitting there was no "common vision" on the island's future.

title.children: Macron delays New Caledonia voting changes after deadly protests

image.altText: A woman is led away by police

props.synopsis: A Victorian mother has been found guilty of forcing her daughter to marry a man, who later went on to murder the young bride.

title.children: Victorian mother found guilty of forcing daughter to marry man who murdered her

image.altText: Ron Dermer speaks from a podium.

props.synopsis: One of Benjamin Netanyahu's top advisers has called allegations made against the Israeli prime minister "outrageous and libellous" while applauding Opposition Leader Peter Dutton.

title.children: Dutton applauded by top Netanyahu advisor over proposal to cut ties with ICC

image.altText: A man sitting on a stage wearing a suit and tie.

props.synopsis: Australia is at risk of "giving up on equity" if governments fail to reform housing and tax policies to improve the economic prospects of younger generations, according to Ross Garnaut, one of the country's most respected economists.

title.children: Leading economist Ross Garnaut says life was much easier for young people when he was their age. Here's why

image.altText: A woman with lots of tattoos plants her hands on her hips and stars fiercely down the barrel of the camera.

props.synopsis: Fight to Live is a new film charting Bec Rawlings's path from a difficult childhood in Launceston to becoming a bare-knuckle boxing world champion. Along the way, it also tackles head-on the issue of domestic violence.

title.children: Bare-knuckle boxing champ Bec Rawlings makes film about domestic violence journey

image.altText: Gladstone brought to life again

props.synopsis: When Cathy Wills came to the small Tasmanian town of Gladstone, nothing much ever happened. That was until she revamped the local pub.

title.children: 'The whole place has just come alive': How a country pub's new owners brought the town back together

image.altText: AFL player Aaron Naughton, lying on the ground, clutching his right knee, screaming in pain

props.synopsis: The Sydney Swans have extended their record to 10 wins and one loss after defeating the Western Bulldogs.

title.children: 'Our players are winners tonight': Injury-ravaged Bulldogs go down fighting as Swans cement themselves on top of the ladder

image.altText: Plibersek looks serious as she speaks to a camera in a corridor of parliament house.

props.synopsis: One of the federal government's most senior ministers, Tanya Plibersek, has raised concerns about a "continued epidemic of sexual assault amongst teenagers" if changes aren't made to how children access online content.

title.children: Minister fears an 'epidemic' of youth sexual assault driven by social media and easy-access pornography

image.altText: A graphic using shots of Ros Bates and Shannon Fentiman.

props.synopsis: A senior Queensland Opposition MP has been referred to a powerful parliamentary ethics committee after refusing to withdraw an accusation a minister had incited violence against her.

title.children: 'Cross your legs': Queensland MP provides context as she's referred to ethics committee over accusation

image.altText: A boy with a walking frame and bandages sits with a child and his mother

props.synopsis: A 12-year-old boy is recovering after being seriously injured when he became trapped in a bus door and dragged along the road.

title.children: Bus driver sacked after young boy trapped by door, dragged along busy road

image.altText: Rugby league player in a hoodie, arrives at a stadium

props.synopsis: Penrith's Taylan May and Manly's Brandon Wakeham are not allowed to take the field after the NRL enacted its no-fault stand down policy, which suspends players if they are charged with criminal offences that carry, if found guilty, maximum jail sentences of 11 or more years.

title.children: Taylan May stood down by NRL over domestic violence charges

image.altText: A man walks with his head down

props.synopsis: A court heard the father of three had an "open door policy" for his workers, including when they were in the shower.

title.children: Farmer found guilty of raping British backpacker at Queensland property

image.altText: Four bodies suspended in blue liquid in cryogenics tanks.

props.synopsis: An unexpected dying request has resulted in a Sydney man being cryogenically frozen in a groundbreaking Australian move.

title.children: Sydney man becomes cryonics facility's first client, with hopes he will eventually be brought back to life

image.altText: A slightly blurry screenshot shows a metal stage structure leaning at an awkward angle over a crowd, mid-collapse.

props.synopsis: The collapse occurred during an event in Nuevo Leon attended by presidential long-shot candidate Jorge Álvarez Máynez, who ran to escape.

title.children: Stage collapses at political rally in Mexico, killing at least nine people

image.altText: A young man and woman hug beside a wrecked home, on which someone has tied an American flag.

props.synopsis: One tornado which tore through the centre of the small town of Greenfield, south-west of Des Moines, left a wide trail of obliterated homes, splintered trees and crumpled cars, before bringing down turbines at a nearby wind farm.

title.children: Five dead, at least 35 hurt as tornadoes rip through Iowa, destroying wind turbines

image.altText: A Taiwan Air Force C-130 aircraft takes off at Hsinchu Air Base in Hsinchu

props.synopsis: China launches drills around Taiwan in response to "separatist acts", sending up heavily armed warplanes and staging mock attacks as state media denounces newly inaugurated President Lai Ching-te.

title.children: Furious China launches 'punishment' drills around Taiwan denouncing its newly inaugurated president

image.altText: Lieutenant General Stephen Sklenka addresses the National Press Club.

props.synopsis: A visiting American general insists Australia will not automatically be dragged into any future conflict with China despite growing integration between both militaries under the AUKUS partnership.

title.children: Australia won't be automatically dragged into future China conflicts, US general says

image.altText: Woman with black curly hair, wearing black sleeveless top, looks at the camera. Sydney Harbour Bridge backdrop.

props.synopsis: Emergency refuge housing is crucial for women and children escaping family violence. A shortage of space is leaving many in the lurch, with nowhere else to go — but one support service has developed an alternative.

title.children: 'So overburdened': Jess Hill on the supply crisis in Australian refuge housing — and how to fix it

image.altText: A woman's sillhoute.

props.synopsis: "Institutionalised" underpayment of social services workers is rife, according to a new report, with many staff not knowing how much they should be getting paid.

title.children: 'It's like a dirty secret': Report reveals how family violence and social workers are being ripped off

image.altText: Woman wearing protective face mask looks ahead next to picture of virus and vaccine injection.

props.synopsis: After a busy start to flu season, we're now bracing for new, highly transmissible COVID-causing subvariants.

title.children: Here's what you need to know about FLiRT, the new highly-transmissible COVID-causing variants

image.altText: a phone screen showing an email from Optus that says "urgent updates"

props.synopsis: The details of millions of Optus customers were exposed when an offshore actor hacked its company database two years ago.

title.children: Optus to defend allegations it didn't properly protect its customers' details in a cyber attack

image.altText: Woman with short blonde hair holds a newborn butterfly

props.synopsis: Butterflies are flying free in a picturesque forest recently created in the Italian Alps to help with biodiversity research.

title.children: In Italy's Alps, scientists turn to tropical butterflies to solve biodiversity crisis

image.altText: On the left, a picture of a man in a grey cap and white shirt smiling On the right, a man with a yellow shirt and a satchel

props.synopsis: Two men who killed Jakob Opacic in a "brutal and cruel" hit-and-run in the Gold Coast hinterland in 2021 have been sentenced in Brisbane.

title.children: Two men jailed over death of motorbike rider in 'brutal' Gold Coast hit-and-run
